user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_digest_auth_check3:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN enum MHD_DigestAuthResult
MHD_digest_auth_check3 (struct MHD_Connection *connection,
                        const char *realm,
                        const char *username,
                        const char *password,
                        unsigned int nonce_timeout,
                        uint32_t max_nc,
                        enum MHD_DigestAuthMultiQOP mqop,
                        enum MHD_DigestAuthMultiAlgo3 malgo3)
{
  mhd_assert (NULL != password);

  return digest_auth_check_all (connection,
                                realm,
                                username,
                                password,
                                NULL,
                                nonce_timeout,
                                max_nc,
                                mqop,
                                malgo3);
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function MHD_digest_auth_check3:
#define mhd_assert(ignore) ((void)0)
...
static enum MHD_DigestAuthResult
digest_auth_check_all (struct MHD_Connection *connection,
                       const char *realm,
                       const char *username,
                       const char *password,
                       const uint8_t *userdigest,
                       unsigned int nonce_timeout,
                       uint32_t max_nc,
                       enum MHD_DigestAuthMultiQOP mqop,
                       enum MHD_DigestAuthMultiAlgo3 malgo3)
{
  enum MHD_DigestAuthResult res;
  char *buf;
  struct DigestAlgorithm da;

  buf = NULL;
  digest_setup_zero (&da);
  if (0 == nonce_timeout)
    nonce_timeout = connection->daemon->dauth_def_nonce_timeout;
  if (0 == max_nc)
    max_nc = connection->daemon->dauth_def_max_nc;
  res = digest_auth_check_all_inner (connection, realm, username, password,
                                     userdigest,
                                     nonce_timeout,
                                     max_nc, mqop, malgo3,
                                     &buf, &da);
  digest_deinit (&da);
  if (NULL != buf)
    free (buf);

  return res;
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No controlling expressions that are compile-time or otherwise invariant were found. The only conditional statements in the provided code are:
- if (0 == nonce_timeout) — depends on the runtime parameter nonce_timeout
- if (0 == max_nc) — depends on the runtime parameter max_nc
- if (NULL != buf) — depends on buf which is assigned by digest_auth_check_all_inner at runtime
These are all runtime-dependent and therefore not invariant. The mhd_assert(NULL != password) macro expands to ((void)0) (a no-op) and is not a controlling statement. There are no loops or switch statements with constant conditions in the supplied code. Consequently, there are no fragments that require investigation under MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3.
